original: @132a # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @132a # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: ba ra da t'a r'a s'a dha nam /
analyzed: ba ra da t'a r'a s'a dha nam /
translated: Varada-Tara-sadhana

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: mchog sbyin sgrol ma'i sgrub thabs /
analyzed: mchog sbyin sgrol ma'i sgrub thabs /
translated: The Means of Achievement of Tara, Bestower of the Supreme

original: 'phags ma sgrol ma la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: 'phags ma sgrol ma la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Noble Tara!

original: sngon ma bzhin du stong pa nyid kyi mthar thug pa bsgoms nas pam yig las skyes pa'i sna tshogs chu skyes kyi dbus su aam yig las skyes pa'i zla ba la t'am yig ljang gu las skyes pa'i sgrol ma sku mdog ljang gu rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan
analyzed: sngon ma bzhin du stong pa nyid kyi mthar thug pa bsgoms nas pam yig las skyes pa'i sna tshogs chu skyes kyi dbus su aam yig las skyes pa'i zla ba la t'am yig ljang gu las skyes pa'i sgrol ma sku mdog ljang gu rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan
translated: Having meditated on emptiness as before, in the center of a multicolored lotus arisen from the syllable Pam, on a moon arisen from the syllable Am, from a green Tam syllable arises green Tara, adorned with all the ornaments,

original: pa / phyag g-yon na autpa la bsnams shing g-yas pa mchog sbyin dang ldan pa /
analyzed: pa / phyag g-yon na autpa la bsnams shing g-yas pa mchog sbyin dang ldan pa /
translated: holding in her left hand an utpala and in her right hand bestowing the boon of protection,

original: skyil krung phyed pas bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: skyil krung phyed pas bzhugs pa'o //
translated: seated in the half-dance posture.

original: g-yas phyogs logs na mya ngan med pa'i 'od zer can ser mo rin po che sna tshogs pa'i cod pan can /
analyzed: g-yas phyogs logs na mya ngan med pa'i 'od zer can ser mo rin po che sna tshogs pa'i cod pan can /
translated: To her right is yellow Sorrowless Marici, wearing a crown of various jewels,

original: g-yon dang g-yas kyi phyag dag gis mya ngan med pa'i shing gi yal ga dang ba ku li bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: g-yon dang g-yas kyi phyag dag gis mya ngan med pa'i shing gi yal ga dang ba ku li bsnams pa'o //
translated: holding in her left and right hands a branch of the Asoka tree and a bakula flower.

original: de bzhin du rma bya chen mo g-yon pa dang cig shos kyi phyag dag gis rma bya'i sgro dang rnga yab bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rma bya chen mo g-yon pa dang cig shos kyi phyag dag gis rma bya'i sgro dang rnga yab bsnams pa'o //
translated: Similarly, Mahāmāyūrī holds a peacock feather and a yak-tail whisk in her left and right hands.

original: g-yon phyogs logs su ral gcig ma thung zhing gnag pa /
analyzed: g-yon phyogs logs su ral gcig ma thung zhing gnag pa /
translated: To the left is Ekajaṭī, short and dark,

original: stag gi pags pa'i na bza' bsnams pa /
analyzed: stag gi pags pa'i na bza' bsnams pa /
translated: wearing a tiger-skin skirt,

original: spyan gsum pa /🔽zhal mche ba gtsigs pa /
analyzed: spyan gsum pa / zhal mche ba gtsigs pa /
translated: with three eyes,🔽her face contorted with bared fangs,

original: skra kham pa gyen du 'bar ba /
analyzed: skra kham pa gyen du 'bar ba /
translated: her tawny hair bristling upward,

original: gri gug dang thod pa bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: gri gug dang thod pa bsnams pa'o //
translated: holding a flaying knife and skull cup.

original: de bzhin du 'phags ma dug sel ma ljang gu g-yon pa dang g-yas pa'i phyag dag gis sbrul nag po dang rnga yab bsnams pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'phags ma dug sel ma ljang gu g-yon pa dang g-yas pa'i phyag dag gis sbrul nag po dang rnga yab bsnams pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, one should visualize Noble Māmakī, green, holding a black snake and a yak-tail whisk in her left and right hands.

original: de bzhin du bsgoms pas ngal na sngags bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bsgoms pas ngal na sngags bzlas par bya'o //
translated: If one becomes tired of meditating in this way, one should recite the mantra.

original: aom t'a re tutt'a re tu re sv'a h'a zhes so //
analyzed: aom t'a re tutt'a re tu re sv'a h'a zhes so //
translated: Oṃ tāre tuttāre ture svāhā.

original: mchog sbyin sgrol ma'i sgrub thabs rdzogs so//
analyzed: mchog sbyin sgrol ma'i sgrub thabs rdzogs so//
translated: The sādhana of Varada Tārā is complete.
